p: Furthermore, studies have revealed inadequate micronutrient levels in patients who were hospitalized in the infectious disease department, including thiamine, selenium, zinc, and vitamin B6 deficiencies ( 36), which were associated with adverse clinical outcomes. Early detection, prevention, and treatment should aim at decreasing the inflammatory response and avoiding the excessive post-inflammatory immune suppression, defined as compensatory response ( 37), that is observed in many such patients ( 38).
